```{r, include = FALSE}
# In this block of code we read the data as a dataframe, clean it and define
# the minimum and maximum worked days
library(lubridate)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(shiny)
library(flexdashboard)
library(ggtext)

df <- data.frame(read.csv("~/.local/share/survey/data.txt"))
colnames(df) <- c("timestamp", "mode", "count")
# df["date"] <- lapply(df["timestamp"], FUN = as_datetime())
df$date <- as_datetime(df$timestamp, tz = "")

df.day.min <- min(date(df$date))
df.day.max <- max(date(df$date))

```

Column {.sidebar}
-----------------------------------------------------------------------


```{r}
# Here we define the selectors on the sidebar
first_day <- today()
mday(first_day) <- 1


sliderInput("day.initial", label = "Initial day of the plot",
            min = df.day.min, max = df.day.max, value = first_day)

selectInput("selected.day",
            label = "Day in which to see hours",
            choices = sort(unique(date(df$date)), decreasing = TRUE))

```

Column
----------------------------------

```{r}
format_seconds <- function(seconds) {
  hours <- seconds %/% 3600
  minutes <- (seconds %% 3600) %/% 60
  return(paste(hours, "h ", minutes, "m"))
}
```

### Hours worked today {.value-box}
```{r}
# Get seconds of today
seconds_today <- df %>%
  filter(date(date) == today()) %>%
  summarize(seconds_today = sum(mode)) %>%
  pull()

renderValueBox({
  valueBox(
    value = format_seconds(seconds_today),
    color = if (duration(seconds_today) < hours(2)) "warning" else "primary"
  )
})
```

### Hours worked this week (Sat-Fri) {.value-box}
```{r}
# Get seconds of this week
last_friday <- today() - wday(today() + 1)
seconds_this_week <- df %>%
  filter(date(date) > last_friday) %>%
  summarise(seconds_this_week = sum(mode)) %>%
  pull()

renderValueBox({
  valueBox(
    value = format_seconds(seconds_this_week),
    color = if (duration(seconds_this_week) < hours(10)) "warning" else "primary"
  )
})
```

### Hours worked this month (20th-19th) {.value-box}
```{r}
# Get seconds of this month
last_19 <- today()
if (mday(last_19) <= 19) {
  last_19 <- last_19 - months(1)
}
mday(last_19) <- 19
seconds_this_month <- df %>%
  filter(date(date) > last_19) %>%
  summarise(seconds_this_month = sum(mode)) %>%
  pull()

renderValueBox({
  valueBox(
    value = format_seconds(seconds_this_month),
  )
})
```

### hh:mm worked in selected day

```{r}
library(hms)
library(tidyr)


renderPlot({
  selected.day.df <- df %>%
    filter(date(date) == input$selected.day) %>%
    mutate(date = round_date(date, "10 min")) %>%
    group_by(intervals = date) %>%
    summarise(seconds = sum(mode))

  selected.day.df$intervals <- as_hms(as_datetime(selected.day.df$intervals, tz = ""))

  # here we create the arrays of lower ticks, when work starts,
  # and upper_ticks, when work ends
  lower_ticks <- c(1)
  upper_ticks <- c(length(selected.day.df$intervals))
  if (length(selected.day.df$intervals) > 1) {
    for (idx in 2:length(selected.day.df$intervals)) {
      print(idx)
      if ((selected.day.df$intervals[idx] - selected.day.df$intervals[idx - 1]) > minutes(10)) {
        upper_ticks <- c(upper_ticks, idx - 1)
        lower_ticks <- c(lower_ticks, idx)
      }
    }
  }

  # this function takes a hms object and returns the string hh:mm
  to_hm <- function(hms) {
    return(format(as.POSIXct(hms), format = "%H:%M"))
  }

  # plot
  # add secondary axis once scales 1.3 reaches stable
  # breaks = selected.day.df$intervals[lower_ticks],
  # sec.axis = dup_axis(name = "Ending time", breaks = selected.day.df$intervals[upper_ticks]),
  ggplot(selected.day.df, aes(x=intervals)) +
    geom_bar(aes(weight=seconds, fill = "blue"), show.legend = FALSE) +
    scale_x_time(name = "Starting time",
                 breaks = selected.day.df$intervals[c(lower_ticks, upper_ticks)],
                 position = "bottom",
                 labels = to_hm,
                 limits=c(parse_hm("06:00"), parse_hm("23:00"))) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
          axis.text.y = element_blank(),
          axis.line.y = element_blank(),
          axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
          axis.title.y = element_blank(),
          axis.title.x = element_text(colour = "#808080"),
          axis.text.x.bottom = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1, colour = "#808080"),
          axis.text.x.top = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 0, colour = "#808080"),
          axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "#808080")
    ) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = c("blue" = "#287FD5"))
})
```

### hh:mm worked per day

```{r}
library(plotly)
# Here we make a graph of the number of hours worked per day

# first we create the array of all the fridays to plot them in the graph later
# we transform it to a dataframe because ggplot works with dataframes
day.tmp <- df.day.min
wday(day.tmp) <- 6
fridays <- seq(day.tmp, df.day.max, by = "1 week")
fridays <- c(fridays, tail(fridays, 1) + weeks(1))
fridays = data.frame(fridays)

# this functions turns the label from seconds to hh:mm
to_hm <- function(seconds) {
  return(sprintf("%02d:%02d", seconds %/% 3600, (seconds %% 3600) %/% 60))
}

# we group by date (ignoring the hms part) and sum the worked seconds
df2 <- df %>%
  group_by(date = date(date)) %>%
  summarise(seconds = sum(mode))

# we set different colors for the hours worked today, yesterday and the other days
colors <- rep("Other", nrow(df2))
colors[df2$date == today()] <- "Today"
colors[df2$date == (today() - days(1))] <- "Yesterday"

# plot
renderPlot({
  ggplot(df2, aes(x=date, y=seconds)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", aes(fill=colors), show.legend = FALSE) +
    xlim(input$day.initial, NA) +
    geom_text(aes(y= seconds, label = to_hm(seconds), colour = "grey"), nudge_y = 1000, vjust=0, size = 3, show.legend = FALSE) +
    geom_text(data = fridays,
              aes(x = fridays, y = Inf, label=paste("friday", day(fridays), "\n"), hjust = 1),
              colour="red",
              angle=90,
              ) +
    geom_vline(xintercept = fridays$fridays, linetype = "dashed", colour = "red") +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
          axis.text.y = element_blank(),
          axis.line.y = element_blank(),
          axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
          axis.title.y = element_blank(),
          axis.title.x = element_text(colour = "#808080"),
          axis.text.x = element_text(colour = "#808080"),
          axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "#808080")
    ) +
    scale_colour_manual(aesthetics = c("colour", "fill"),
                        values = c("grey" = "#808080", "Other" = "#287FD5", "Yesterday" = "#3333FF", "Today" = "#001580"),
                        limits = c("Other", "Yesterday", "Today"))
})
```


### hh:mm worked per month (from 20th of the current month to 19th of the following)

```{r}
# working months usually go from the 19th of the current month to the 20th of the following
df3 <- df
# when the day is greater than 19 we put the survey in the following month
df3$month <- floor_date(df$date, "month") + months(ifelse(day(df$date) > 19, 0, -1))
# group by month
df3 <- df3 %>%
  group_by(month = month) %>%
  summarise(seconds = sum(mode))

# plot
renderPlot(
  ggplot(df3, aes(x=month, y=seconds)) +
    geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#287FD5") +
    geom_text(aes(y= 1.05 * seconds, label = to_hm(seconds)), colour = "#808080", vjust=0) +
    theme_classic() +
    theme(
          axis.text.y = element_blank(),
          axis.line.y = element_blank(),
          axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
          axis.title.y = element_blank(),
          axis.title.x = element_text(colour = "#808080"),
          axis.line.x = element_line(colour = "#808080"),
  )
)
```
